00152  /*! enum. Border
00153      desc.
00154          Border Directions
00155          
00156          
00157          +---------------------+
00158          |\       NORTH       /|
00159          | \                 / |
00160          |  +---------------+  |
00161          |  |               |  |
00162          | W|               |E |
00163          | E|               |A |
00164          | S|               |S |
00165          | T|               |T |
00166          |  |               |  |
00167          |  +---------------+  |
00168          | /      SOUTH      \ |
00169          |/                   \|
00170          +---------------------+
00171  */
00172  enum Border

00174   Border_North = 0,
00175   Border_South = 1,
00176   Border_East  = 2,
00177   Border_West  = 3

00193      desc.
00194          Horizontal text alignment for captions.
00195  */
00196  enum TextAlignment
00197  {
00198   TextAlign_Left,   // Place the text to where left is (X = left)
00199   TextAlign_Right,  // Place the text to the right of left (X = left - text_width)
00200   TextAlign_Centre, // Place the text centered at left (X = left - (text_width / 2 ) )
00201  };

00214  /*! enum. buffer<T>
00215      desc.
00216          Internal container class that is similar to std::vector
00217  */
00218  template<typename T> class buffer
00219  {
00220    
00221   public:
00222    
00223    inline buffer() : mBuffer(0), mUsed(0), mCapacity(0)
00224    { // no code.
00225    }
00226   
00227    inline ~buffer()
00228    {
00229     if (mBuffer && mCapacity)
00230      OGRE_FREE(mBuffer, Ogre::MEMCATEGORY_GEOMETRY);
00231    }
00232    
00233    inline size_t size() const
00234    {
00235     return mUsed;
00236    }
00237    
00238    inline size_t capacity() const
00239    {
00240     return mCapacity;
00241    }
00242    
00243    inline T& operator[](size_t index)
00244    {
00245     return *(mBuffer + index);
00246    }
00247 
00248    inline const T& operator[](size_t index) const
00249    {
00250     return *(mBuffer + index);
00251    }
00252 
00253    inline T& at(size_t index)
00254    {
00255     return *(mBuffer + index);
00256    }
00257 
00258    inline const T& at(size_t index) const
00259    {
00260     return *(mBuffer + index);
00261    }
00262    
00263    inline void remove_all()
00264    {
00265     mUsed = 0;
00266    }
00267     
00268    inline void resize(size_t new_capacity)
00269    {
00270     T* new_buffer = (T*) OGRE_MALLOC(sizeof(T) * new_capacity, Ogre::MEMCATEGORY_GEOMETRY);
00271     
00272     if (mUsed != 0)
00273     {
00274      if (mUsed < new_capacity)  // Copy all
00275       std::copy(mBuffer, mBuffer + mUsed, new_buffer);
00276      else if (mUsed >= new_capacity) // Copy some
00277       std::copy(mBuffer, mBuffer + new_capacity, new_buffer);
00278     }
00279     
00280     OGRE_FREE(mBuffer, Ogre::MEMCATEGORY_GEOMETRY);
00281     mCapacity = new_capacity;
00282     mBuffer = new_buffer;
00283    }
00284    
00285    inline void push_back(const T& value)
00286    {
00287     if (mUsed == mCapacity)
00288      resize(mUsed == 0 ? 1 : mUsed * 2);
00289     *(mBuffer + mUsed) = value;
00290     mUsed++;
00291    }
00292    
00293    inline void pop_back()
00294    {
00295     if (mUsed != 0)
00296      mUsed--;
00297    }
00298    
00299    inline void erase(size_t index)
00300    {
00301     *(mBuffer + index) = *(mBuffer + mUsed - 1);
00302     mUsed--;
00303    }
00304    
00305    inline  T* first()
00306    {
00307     return mBuffer;
00308    }
00309    
00310    inline T* last()
00311    {
00312     return mBuffer + mUsed;
00313    }
00314    
00315   protected:
00316    
00317    T*     mBuffer;
00318    size_t mUsed, mCapacity;
00319  };
00320

00332  /*! struct. Kerning
00333      desc.
00334          Distances between two characters next to each other.
00335  */
00336  struct Kerning
00337  {
00338   Kerning(Ogre::uint c, Ogre::Real k) : character(c), kerning(k) {}
00339   Ogre::uint character;
00340   Ogre::Real kerning;
00341  };
00342  
00343  /*! struct. Glyph
00344      desc.
00345          Texture and size information about a single character loaded from a TextureAtlas.
00346  */
00347  class Glyph : public Ogre::GeneralAllocatedObject
00348  {
00349    
00350   public:
00351    
00352    Glyph() : uvTop(0), uvBottom(0), uvWidth(0), uvHeight(0), uvLeft(0), uvRight(0), glyphWidth(0), glyphHeight(0), glyphAdvance(0), verticalOffset(0) {}
00353    
00354   ~Glyph() {}
00355    
00356    Ogre::Vector2    texCoords[4];
00357    Ogre::Real uvTop, uvBottom, uvWidth, uvHeight, uvLeft, uvRight,
00358                        glyphWidth, glyphHeight, glyphAdvance, verticalOffset;
00359    buffer<Kerning> kerning;
00360    
00361    // Get kerning value of a character to the right of another.
00362    // Ab -- get the kerning value of b, pass on A.
00363    inline const Ogre::Real getKerning(char left_of) const
00364    {
00365     if (kerning.size() == 0)
00366      return 0;
00367     for (size_t i=0;i < kerning.size();i++)
00368     {
00369      if (kerning[i].character == left_of)
00370       return kerning[i].kerning;
00371     }
00372     return 0;
00373    }
00374    
00375  };
00376

00387    
00388   ~Sprite() {}
00389

00391    Ogre::Vector2    texCoords[4];
00392    
00393  };

00395  /* class. Silverback
00396     desc.
00397         Main singleton class for Gorilla
00398  */
00399  class Silverback : public Ogre::Singleton<Silverback>, public Ogre::GeneralAllocatedObject, public Ogre::FrameListener
00400  {
00401    
00402   public:
00403    
00404    /*! constructor. Silverback
00405        desc.
00406            Silverback constructor.
00407    */
00408    Silverback();
00409    
00410    /*! destructor. Silverback
00411        desc.
00412            Silverback destructor.
00413    */
00414   ~Silverback();
00415    
00416    /*! function. loadAtlas
00417        desc.
00418            Create a TextureAtlas from a ".gorilla" file. 
00419            
00420            Name is the name of the TextureAtlas, as well as the first part of the filename
00421            of the gorilla file; i.e. name.gorilla, the gorilla file can be loaded from a different
00422            resource group if you give that name as the second argument, otherwise it will assume 
00423            to be "General".
00424    */
00425    void loadAtlas(const Ogre::String& name, const Ogre::String& group = Ogre::ResourceGroupManager::DEFAULT_RESOURCE_GROUP_NAME);
00426    
00427    /*! function. createScreen
00428        desc.
00429            Create a Screen using a Viewport and a name of a previously loaded TextureAtlas.
00430            Both must exist. The screen will register itself as a RenderQueueListener to the
00431            SceneManager that has the Camera which is tied to the Viewport.
00432        note.
00433            Each screen is considered a new batch. To reduce your batch count in Gorilla, 
00434            reduce the number of screens you use.
00435    */
00436    Screen* createScreen(Ogre::Viewport*, const Ogre::String& atlas);
00437    
00438    /*! function. destroyScreen
00439        desc.
00440            Destroy an existing screen, its layers and the contents of those layers.
00441    */
00442    void destroyScreen(Screen*);
00443    
00444    /*! function. createScreenRenderable
00445    */
00446    ScreenRenderable* createScreenRenderable(const Ogre::Vector2& maxSize, const Ogre::String& atlas);
00447    
00448    /*! function. destroyScreen
00449        desc.
00450            Destroy an existing screen, its layers and the contents of those layers.
00451    */
00452    void destroyScreenRenderable(ScreenRenderable*);
00453    
00454    /*! function. frameStarted
00455        desc.
00456            Call ScreenRenderable draw
00457    */
00458    bool frameStarted(const Ogre::FrameEvent& evt);
00459    
00460   protected:
00461    
00462    std::map<Ogre::String, TextureAtlas*>  mAtlases;
00463    std::vector<Screen*>                   mScreens;
00464    std::vector<ScreenRenderable*>         mScreenRenderables;
00465    
00466  };

00468  /*! class. GlyphData
00469      desc.
00470          Collection of glyphs of the same size.
00471  */
00472  class GlyphData : public Ogre::GeneralAllocatedObject
00473  {
00474    
00475   friend class TextureAtlas;
00476    
00477    public:
00478     
00479     GlyphData();
00480     
00481    ~GlyphData();
00482     
00483     /*! function. getGlyph
00484         desc.
00485             Get a glyph (character information) from a specific character.
00486         note.
00487             If the character doesn't exist then a null pointer is returned.
00488             Do not delete the Glyph pointer.
00489     */
00490     inline Glyph* getGlyph(Ogre::uint character) const
00491     {
00492      Ogre::uint safe_character = character - mRangeBegin;
00493      if (safe_character >= 0 && safe_character <= mGlyphs.size())
00494       return mGlyphs[safe_character];
00495      return 0;
00496     }
00497     
00498     std::vector<Glyph*>  mGlyphs;
00499     Ogre::uint           mRangeBegin, mRangeEnd;
00500     Ogre::Real           mSpaceLength,
00501                          mLineHeight,
00502                          mBaseline,
00503                          mLetterSpacing,
00504                          mMonoWidth;
00505    
00506  };
00507  
00508  /*! class. TextureAtlas
00509      desc.
00510           The TextureAtlas file represents a .gorilla file which contains all the needed information that
00511           describes the portions of a single texture. Such as Glyph and Sprite information, text kerning,
00512           line heights and so on. It isn't typically used by the end-user.
00513  */
00514  class TextureAtlas : public Ogre::GeneralAllocatedObject
00515  {
00516    
00517    friend class Silverback;
00518    
00519    public:
00520     
00521     Ogre::MaterialPtr createOrGet2DMasterMaterial();
00522     
00523     Ogre::MaterialPtr createOrGet3DMasterMaterial();
00524     
00525     /*! function. getTexture
00526         desc.
00527             Get the texture assigned to this TextureAtlas
00528     */
00529     inline Ogre::TexturePtr getTexture() const
00530     {
00531      return mTexture;
00532     }
00533     
00534     /*! function. getMaterial
00535         desc.
00536             Get the material assigned to this TextureAtlas
00537     */
00538     inline Ogre::MaterialPtr get2DMaterial() const
00539     {
00540      return m2DMaterial;
00541     }
00542     
00543     /*! function. getMaterial
00544         desc.
00545             Get the material assigned to this TextureAtlas
00546     */
00547     inline Ogre::MaterialPtr get3DMaterial() const
00548     {
00549      return m3DMaterial;
00550     }
00551     /*! function. getMaterialName
00552         desc.
00553             Get the name of the material assigned to this TextureAtlas
00554     */
00555     inline Ogre::String get2DMaterialName() const
00556     {
00557      return m2DMaterial->getName();
00558     }
00559     /*! function. getMaterialName
00560         desc.
00561             Get the name of the material assigned to this TextureAtlas
00562     */
00563     inline Ogre::String get3DMaterialName() const
00564     {
00565      return m3DMaterial->getName();
00566     }
00567     
00568     inline GlyphData* getGlyphData(Ogre::uint index) const
00569     {
00570      std::map<Ogre::uint, GlyphData*>::const_iterator it = mGlyphData.find(index);
00571      if (it == mGlyphData.end())
00572       return 0;
00573      return (*it).second;
00574     }
00575     
00576     /*! function. getSprite
00577         desc.
00578             Get a sprite (portion of a texture) from a name.
00579         note.
00580             If the sprite doesn't exist then a null pointer is returned.
00581             Do not delete the Sprite pointer.
00582     */
00583     inline Sprite* getSprite(const Ogre::String& name) const
00584     {
00585      std::map<Ogre::String, Sprite*>::const_iterator it = mSprites.find(name);
00586      if (it == mSprites.end())
00587       return 0;
00588      return (*it).second;
00589     }
00590     
00591     /*! function. getGlyphKerning
00592         desc.
00593             Get the UV information for a designated white pixel in the texture.
00594         note.
00595             Units are in relative coordinates (0..1)
00596     */
00597     inline Ogre::Vector2 getWhitePixel() const
00598     {
00599      return mWhitePixel;
00600     }
00601     
00602     /*! function. getGlyphKerning
00603         desc.
00604             Get the X coordinate for a designated white pixel in the texture.
00605         note.
00606             Units are in relative coordinates (0..1)
00607  
00608     */
00609     inline Ogre::Real getWhitePixelX() const
00610     {
00611      return mWhitePixel.x;
00612     }
00613     
00614     /*! function. getGlyphKerning
00615         desc.
00616             Get the Y coordinate for a designated white pixel in the texture.
00617         note.
00618             Units are in relative coordinates (0..1)
00619     */
00620     inline Ogre::Real getWhitePixelY() const
00621     {
00622      return mWhitePixel.y;
00623     }
00624     
00625     /*! function. getTextureSize
00626         desc.
00627             Get the size of the texture.
00628     */
00629     inline Ogre::Vector2 getTextureSize() const
00630     {
00631      return Ogre::Vector2(Ogre::Real(mTexture->getWidth()), Ogre::Real(mTexture->getHeight()));
00632     }
00633 
00634     /*! function. getTextureSize
00635         desc.
00636             Get the reciprocal of the width of the texture.
00637     */
00638     inline Ogre::Real getInvTextureCoordsX() const
00639     {
00640      return 1.0f / Ogre::Real(mTexture->getWidth());
00641     }
00642     
00643     /*! function. getTextureSize
00644         desc.
00645             Get the reciprocal of the height of the texture.
00646     */
00647     inline Ogre::Real getInvTextureCoordsY() const
00648     {
00649      return 1.0f / Ogre::Real(mTexture->getHeight());
00650     }
00651 
00652     /*! function. getPass
00653         desc.
00654             Get the first pass of the material used by this TextureAtlas
00655     */
00656     inline Ogre::Pass* get2DPass() const
00657     {
00658      return m2DPass;
00659     }
00660     
00661     /*! function. getGlyphMonoWidth
00662         desc.
00663             Reset the ten markup colours used in the MarkupText, by default these are:
00664            
00665              0 = 255, 255, 255
00666              1 = 0, 0, 0
00667              2 = 204, 204, 204
00668              3 = 254, 220, 129
00669              4 = 254, 138, 129
00670              5 = 123, 236, 110
00671              6 = 44,  192, 171
00672              7 = 199, 93,  142
00673              8 = 254, 254, 254
00674              9 = 13,  13,  13
00675     */
00676     void refreshMarkupColours();
00677     
00678     /*! function. setMarkupColour
00679         desc.
00680             Change one of the ten markup colours.
00681         note.
00682             colour_palette_index must be between or equal to 0 and 9.
00683     */
00684     void setMarkupColour(Ogre::uint colour_palette_index, const Ogre::ColourValue&);
00685     
00686     /*! function. getMarkupColour
00687         desc.
00688             Get one of the ten markup colours.
00689         note.
00690             colour_palette_index must be between or equal to 0 and 9.
00691     */
00692     Ogre::ColourValue getMarkupColour(Ogre::uint colour_palette_index);
00693     
00694    protected:
00695     
00696     TextureAtlas(const Ogre::String& gorillaFile, const Ogre::String& group);
00697     
00698    ~TextureAtlas();
00699     
00700     void  _reset();
00701     void  _load(const Ogre::String& gorillaFile, const Ogre::String& groupName);
00702     void  _loadTexture(Ogre::ConfigFile::SettingsMultiMap*);
00703     void  _loadGlyphs(Ogre::ConfigFile::SettingsMultiMap*, GlyphData*);
00704     void  _loadKerning(Ogre::ConfigFile::SettingsMultiMap*, GlyphData*);
00705     void  _loadVerticalOffsets(Ogre::ConfigFile::SettingsMultiMap*, GlyphData*);
00706     void  _loadSprites(Ogre::ConfigFile::SettingsMultiMap*);
00707     void  _create2DMaterial();
00708     void  _create3DMaterial();
00709     void  _calculateCoordinates();
00710    
00711     Ogre::TexturePtr                  mTexture;
00712     Ogre::MaterialPtr                 m2DMaterial, m3DMaterial;
00713     Ogre::Pass*                       m2DPass, *m3DPass;
00714     std::map<Ogre::uint, GlyphData*>  mGlyphData;
00715     std::map<Ogre::String, Sprite*>   mSprites;
00716     Ogre::Vector2                     mWhitePixel;
00717     Ogre::Vector2                     mInverseTextureSize;
00718     Ogre::ColourValue                 mMarkupColour[10];
00719     
00720   };
00721   
00722   class LayerContainer
00723   {
00724     
00725    public:
00726     
00727     LayerContainer(TextureAtlas*);
00728     
00729     virtual ~LayerContainer();
00730     
00731     /*! function. createLayer
00732         desc.
00733             Create a layer for drawing on to.
00734             
00735             Index represents the z-order, 0 being the layer drawn first and 15
00736             the layer drawn last. Layers drawn after another layer will appear
00737             to be top than the other.
00738             
00739         note.
00740             Index must be between or equal to 0 and 15. Any other value will cause
00741             a very nasty crash.
00742     */
00743     Layer*  createLayer(Ogre::uint index = 0);
00744     
00745     /*! function. destroyLayer
00746         desc.
00747             Destroy a layer and it's contents.
00748     */
00749     void   destroy(Layer* layer);
00750     
00751     /*! function. getAtlas
00752         desc.
00753             Get atlas assigned to this LayerContainer
00754     */
00755     TextureAtlas* getAtlas() const { return mAtlas; }
00756     
00757     virtual Ogre::Real getTexelOffsetX() const { return 0.0f; }
00758     
00759     virtual Ogre::Real getTexelOffsetY() const { return 0.0f; }
00760     
00761     /*! function. _createVertexBuffer
00762         desc.
00763             Create the vertex buffer
00764     */
00765     void _createVertexBuffer(size_t initialSize);
00766 
00767     /*! function. _destroyVertexBuffer
00768         desc.
00769             Destroy the vertex buffer
00770     */
00771     void _destroyVertexBuffer();
00772 
00773     /*! function. _resizeVertexBuffer
00774         desc.
00775             Resize the vertex buffer to the greatest nearest power 
00776             of 2 of requestedSize.
00777     */
00778     void _resizeVertexBuffer(size_t requestedSize);
00779     
00780     /* function. _recalculateIndexes
00781        desc.
00782            Clear mIndexes, mIndexVertices and mIndexRedraw, 
00783            and from mLayers fill them out again. A full redraw
00784            is required.
00785     */
00786     void _recalculateIndexes();
00787     
00788     /*! function. _redrawIndex
00789         desc.
00790             Redraw all layers of an index.
00791             If force is true, then all elements of that layer
00792             will be redrawn regardless of anything has changed
00793             or not.
00794     */
00795     void _redrawIndex(Ogre::uint id, bool force);
00796     
00797     /*! function. _redrawAllIndexes
00798         desc.
00799             Redraw all layers of all indexes
00800             If force is true, then all elements of all layers
00801             will be redrawn regardless of anything has changed
00802             or not.
00803     */
00804     void _redrawAllIndexes(bool force = false);
00805     
00806     /*! function. _redrawAllIndexes
00807         desc.
00808             Redraw a redraw of an index on the next call of _renderVertices
00809     */
00810     void _requestIndexRedraw(Ogre::uint index);
00811     
00812     /*! function. _renderVertices
00813         desc.
00814             Bundle up mIndexData (redraw any if needed) then copy them
00815             into mVertexBuffer, and update mRenderOpPtr with the new 
00816             vertex count.
00817     */
00818     void _renderVertices(bool force = false);
00819     
00820     /*! function. renderOnce
00821         desc.
00822             Draw the vertices from mVertexBuffer into Ogre.
00823     */
00824     virtual void renderOnce() = 0;
00825     
00826     virtual void _transform(buffer<Vertex>& vertices, size_t begin, size_t end) {}
00827     
00828    protected:
00829     
00830     /// mLayers -- Master copy of all layers of this Target.
00831     std::vector<Layer*>     mLayers;
00832     
00833     struct IndexData : public Ogre::GeneralAllocatedObject
00834     {
00835      std::vector<Layer*>    mLayers;
00836      buffer<Vertex>         mVertices;
00837      bool                   mRedrawNeeded;
00838     };
00839     
00840     /// mIndexes -- Copies pointers to Layers arranged their index.
00841     std::map< Ogre::uint, IndexData* >  mIndexData;
00842     
00843     /// mIndexRedrawNeeded -- An index (not sure what) needs to be redrawn.
00844     bool  mIndexRedrawNeeded;
00845     
00846     /// mRedrawAll -- All indexes need to be redrawn regardless of state.
00847     bool  mIndexRedrawAll;
00848     
00849     /// mVertexBuffer -- Compiled layers of all indexes go into here for rendering directly to the screen or scene.
00850     Ogre::HardwareVertexBufferSharedPtr   mVertexBuffer;
00851     
00852     /// mVertexBufferSize -- How much the VertexBuffer can hold.
00853     size_t  mVertexBufferSize;
00854     
00855     /// mRenderOpPtr -- Pointer to the RenderOperation (Not owned by LayerContainer)
00856     Ogre::RenderOperation*  mRenderOpPtr;
00857     
00858     /// Atlas assigned to this LayerContainer
00859     TextureAtlas*  mAtlas;
00860     
00861   };
00862   
00863   
00864   class Screen : public LayerContainer, public Ogre::RenderQueueListener, public Ogre::GeneralAllocatedObject
00865   {
00866    public:
00867     
00868     friend class Silverback;
00869     friend class Layer;
00870     
00871     /*! desc. getTexelOffsetX
00872             Helper function to get horizontal texel offset.
00873     */
00874     inline Ogre::Real getTexelOffsetX() const { return mRenderSystem->getHorizontalTexelOffset(); }
00875 
00876     /*! desc. getTexelOffsetY
00877             Helper function to get vertical texel offset.
00878     */
00879     inline Ogre::Real getTexelOffsetY() const { return mRenderSystem->getVerticalTexelOffset(); }
00880     
00881     /*! desc. getWidth
00882             Get screen height in pixels.
00883     */
00884     inline Ogre::Real getWidth() const { return mWidth; }
00885     
00886     /*! desc. getHeight
00887             Get screen height in pixels.
00888     */
00889     inline Ogre::Real getHeight() const { return mHeight; }
00890     
00891     /*! desc. isVisible
00892             Is the screen and it's contents visible or not?
00893         note.
00894             If the screen is hidden, then it is not rendered which decrease the batch count by one.
00895     */
00896     inline bool isVisible() const { return mIsVisible; }
00897     
00898     /*! desc. setVisible
00899             Show or hide the screen.
00900     */
00901     inline void setVisible(bool value) { mIsVisible = value;}
00902     
00903     /*! desc. hide
00904             Hide the screen and the all of layers within it.
00905     */
00906     inline void hide() { mIsVisible = false;}
00907     
00908     /*! desc. show
00909             Show the screen and the visible layers within it.
00910     */
00911     inline void show() { mIsVisible = true;}
00912     
00913 #if OGRE_NO_VIEWPORT_ORIENTATIONMODE == 1
00914     inline void setOrientation(Ogre::OrientationMode o)
00915     {
00916       mOrientation = o; mOrientationChanged = true;
00917 
00918       if (mOrientation == Ogre::OR_DEGREE_90 || mOrientation == Ogre::OR_DEGREE_270)
00919       {
00920        std::swap(mWidth, mHeight);
00921        std::swap(mInvWidth, mInvHeight);
00922       }
00923     }
00924 #endif
00925    protected:
00926     
00927     /*! constructor. Screen
00928         desc.
00929             Use Silverback::createScreen
00930     */
00931     Screen(Ogre::Viewport*, TextureAtlas*);
00932     
00933     /*! destructor. Screen
00934         desc.
00935             Use Silverback::destroyScreen
00936     */
00937    ~Screen();
00938     
00939     // Internal -- Not used, but required by renderQueueListener
00940     void renderQueueStarted(Ogre::uint8, const Ogre::String&, bool&) {}
00941     
00942     // Internal -- Called by Ogre to render the screen.
00943     void renderQueueEnded(Ogre::uint8 queueGroupId, const Ogre::String& invocation, bool& repeatThisInvocation);
00944     
00945     // Internal -- Prepares RenderSystem for rendering.
00946     void _prepareRenderSystem();
00947     
00948     // Internal -- Renders mVertexData to screen.
00949     void renderOnce();
00950     
00951     // Internal -- Used to transform vertices using units of pixels into screen coordinates.
00952     void _transform(buffer<Vertex>& vertices, size_t begin, size_t end);
00953     
00954     Ogre::RenderOperation mRenderOp;
00955     Ogre::SceneManager*   mSceneMgr;
00956     Ogre::RenderSystem*   mRenderSystem;
00957     Ogre::Viewport*       mViewport;
00958     Ogre::Real            mWidth, mHeight, mInvWidth, mInvHeight;
00959     Ogre::OrientationMode mOrientation;
00960 #if OGRE_NO_VIEWPORT_ORIENTATIONMODE == 1
00961     bool                  mOrientationChanged;
00962 #endif
00963     Ogre::Vector3         mScale;
00964     bool                  mIsVisible;
00965     bool                  mCanRender;
00966     Ogre::Matrix4         mVertexTransform;
00967     
00968   };
00969   
00970   class ScreenRenderable : public LayerContainer, public Ogre::SimpleRenderable
00971   {
00972    
00973    public:
00974     
00975     ScreenRenderable(const Ogre::Vector2& maxSize, TextureAtlas*);
00976     
00977    ~ScreenRenderable();
00978     
00979     void frameStarted();
00980     void renderOnce();
00981     void _transform(buffer<Vertex>& vertices, size_t begin, size_t end);
00982     void calculateBoundingBox();
00983 
00984     Ogre::Real getBoundingRadius(void) const { return mBox.getMaximum().squaredLength(); }
00985   
00986     Ogre::Real getSquaredViewDepth(const Ogre::Camera* cam) const
00987     {
00988      Ogre::Vector3 min, max, mid, dist;
00989      min = mBox.getMinimum();
00990      max = mBox.getMaximum();
00991      mid = ((max - min) * 0.5) + min;
00992      dist = cam->getDerivedPosition() - mid;
00993      return dist.squaredLength();
00994     }
00995     
00996    protected:
00997     
00998     Ogre::SceneManager*   mSceneMgr;
00999     Ogre::RenderSystem*   mRenderSystem;
01000     Ogre::Viewport*       mViewport;
01001     Ogre::Vector2         mMaxSize;
01002     
01003   };
01004   
01005   /*! class. Layer
01006       desc.
01007           Text
01008   */
01009   class Layer : public Ogre::GeneralAllocatedObject
01010   {
01011    
01012    friend class LayerContainer;
01013    
01014    public:
01015     
01016     typedef Gorilla::VectorType<Rectangle*>::type            Rectangles;
01017     typedef Ogre::VectorIterator<Rectangles>                 RectangleIterator;
01018     typedef Gorilla::VectorType<Polygon*>::type              Polygons;
01019     typedef Ogre::VectorIterator<Polygons>                   PolygonIterator;
01020     typedef Gorilla::VectorType<LineList*>::type             LineLists;
01021     typedef Ogre::VectorIterator<LineLists>                  LineListIterator;
01022     typedef Gorilla::VectorType<QuadList*>::type             QuadLists;
01023     typedef Ogre::VectorIterator<QuadLists>                  QuadListIterator;
01024     typedef Gorilla::VectorType<Caption*>::type              Captions;
01025     typedef Ogre::VectorIterator<Captions>                   CaptionIterator;
01026     typedef Gorilla::VectorType<MarkupText*>::type           MarkupTexts;
01027     typedef Ogre::VectorIterator<MarkupTexts>                MarkupTextIterator;
01028     
01029     /*! function. isVisible
01030         desc.
01031             Is the layer being drawn on screen or not?
01032     */
01033     inline  bool isVisible() const
01034     {
01035      return mVisible;
01036     }
01037     
01038     /*! function. setVisible
01039         desc.
01040             Show or hide the layer
01041     */
01042     inline void setVisible(bool isVisible)
01043     {
01044      if (mVisible == isVisible)
01045       return;
01046      mVisible = isVisible;
01047      _markDirty();
01048     }
01049     
01050     /*! function. show
01051         desc.
01052             Show the layer
01053     */
01054     inline void show()
01055     {
01056      if (mVisible)
01057       return;
01058      mVisible = true;
01059      _markDirty();
01060     }
01061 
01062     /*! function. hide
01063         desc.
01064             hide the layer
01065     */
01066     inline void hide()
01067     {
01068      if (!mVisible)
01069       return;
01070      mVisible = false;
01071      _markDirty();
01072     }
01073     
01074     /*! function. setAlphaModifier
01075         desc.
01076             Set's a modifier to the alpha component of all colours of the vertices that make up this layer
01077         note.
01078             Final alpha value of all vertices in this layer is the following:
01079               
01080              final_alpha = vertex_alpha * alphaModifier;
01081             
01082             Alpha modifier should be between 0.0 and 1.0
01083     */
01084     void setAlphaModifier(const Ogre::Real& alphaModifier)
01085     {
01086      mAlphaModifier = alphaModifier;
01087      _markDirty();
01088     }
01089     
01090     /*! function. getAlphaModifier
01091         desc.
01092             Set's a modifier to the alpha component of all colours of the vertices that make up this layer
01093     */
01094     Ogre::Real getAlphaModifier() const
01095     {
01096      return mAlphaModifier;
01097     }
01098     
01099     /*! function. createRectangle
01100         desc.
01101             Creates a rectangle.
01102     */
01103     Rectangle*         createRectangle(Ogre::Real left, Ogre::Real top, Ogre::Real width = 100, Ogre::Real height = 100);
01104     
01105     /*! function. createRectangle
01106         desc.
01107             Creates a rectangle.
01108     */
01109     Rectangle*         createRectangle(const Ogre::Vector2& position, const Ogre::Vector2& size = Ogre::Vector2(100,100))
01110     {
01111      return createRectangle(position.x, position.y, size.x, size.y);
01112     }
01113     
01114     /*! function. destroyRectangle
01115         desc.
01116             Removes a rectangle from the layer and *deletes* it.
01117     */
01118     void               destroyRectangle(Rectangle*);
01119     
01120     /*! function. destroyAllRectangles
01121         desc.
01122             Removes all rectangles from the layer and *deletes* them.
01123     */
01124     void               destroyAllRectangles();
01125     
01126     /*! function. getRectangles
01127         desc.
01128             Get an iterator to all the rectangles in this layer.
01129     */
01130     RectangleIterator  getRectangles()
01131     {
01132      return RectangleIterator(mRectangles.begin(), mRectangles.end());
01133     }
01134     
01135     /*! function. createPolygon
01136         desc.
01137             Creates a regular polygon.
01138     */
01139     Polygon*         createPolygon(Ogre::Real left, Ogre::Real top, Ogre::Real radius = 100, Ogre::uint sides = 6);
01140     
01141     /*! function. destroyPolygon
01142         desc.
01143             Removes a polygon from the layer and *deletes* it.
01144     */
01145     void               destroyPolygon(Polygon*);
01146     
01147     /*! function. destroyAllPolygons
01148         desc.
01149             Removes all polygons from the layer and *deletes* them.
01150     */
01151     void               destroyAllPolygons();
01152     
01153     /*! function. getPolygons
01154         desc.
01155             Get an iterator to all the polygons in this layer.
01156     */
01157     PolygonIterator  getPolygons()
01158     {
01159      return PolygonIterator(mPolygons.begin(), mPolygons.end());
01160     }
01161     
01162     
01163     /*! function. createLineList
01164         desc.
01165             Creates a line list.
01166     */
01167     LineList*         createLineList();
01168     
01169     /*! function. destroyLineList
01170         desc.
01171             Removes a line list from the layer and *deletes* it.
01172     */
01173     void               destroyLineList(LineList*);
01174     
01175     /*! function. destroyAllLineLists
01176         desc.
01177             Removes all line lists from the layer and *deletes* them.
01178     */
01179     void               destroyAllLineLists();
01180     
01181     /*! function. getLineLists
01182         desc.
01183             Get an iterator to all the line lists in this layer.
01184     */
01185     LineListIterator  getLineLists()
01186     {
01187      return LineListIterator(mLineLists.begin(), mLineLists.end());
01188     }
01189     
01190     /*! function. createQuadList
01191         desc.
01192             Creates a quad list.
01193     */
01194     QuadList*         createQuadList();
01195     
01196     /*! function. destroyQuadList
01197         desc.
01198             Removes a quad list from the layer and *deletes* it.
01199     */
01200     void               destroyQuadList(QuadList*);
01201     
01202     /*! function. destroyAllQuadLists
01203         desc.
01204             Removes all quad lists from the layer and *deletes* them.
01205     */
01206     void               destroyAllQuadLists();
01207     
01208     /*! function. getQuadLists
01209         desc.
01210             Get an iterator to all the quad lists in this layer.
01211     */
01212     QuadListIterator  getQuadLists()
01213     {
01214      return QuadListIterator(mQuadLists.begin(), mQuadLists.end());
01215     }
01216     
01217     /*! function. createCaption
01218         desc.
01219             Creates a caption
01220     */
01221     Caption*         createCaption(Ogre::uint glyphDataIndex, Ogre::Real x, Ogre::Real y, const Ogre::String& text);
01222     
01223     /*! function. destroyCaption
01224         desc.
01225             Removes a caption from the layer and *deletes* it.
01226     */
01227     void               destroyCaption(Caption*);
01228     
01229     /*! function. destroyAllCaptions
01230         desc.
01231             Removes all caption from the layer and *deletes* them.
01232     */
01233     void               destroyAllCaptions();
01234     
01235     /*! function. getCaptions
01236         desc.
01237             Get an iterator to all the quad lists in this layer.
01238     */
01239     CaptionIterator  getCaptions()
01240     {
01241      return CaptionIterator(mCaptions.begin(), mCaptions.end());
01242     }
01243 
01244     /*! function. createMarkupText
01245         desc.
01246             Creates a markup text
01247     */
01248     MarkupText*         createMarkupText(Ogre::uint defaultGlyphIndex, Ogre::Real x, Ogre::Real y, const Ogre::String& text);
01249     
01250     /*! function. destroyMarkupText
01251         desc.
01252             Removes a markup text from the layer and *deletes* it.
01253     */
01254     void               destroyMarkupText(MarkupText*);
01255     
01256     /*! function. destroyAllMarkupTexts
01257         desc.
01258             Removes all markup text from the layer and *deletes* them.
01259     */
01260     void               destroyAllMarkupTexts();
01261     
01262     /*! function. getMarkupTexts
01263         desc.
01264             Get an iterator to all the quad lists in this layer.
01265     */
01266     MarkupTextIterator  getMarkupTexts()
01267     {
01268      return MarkupTextIterator(mMarkupTexts.begin(), mMarkupTexts.end());
01269     }
01270 
01271     /*! function. getIndex
01272         desc.
01273             Get render index
01274     */
01275     Ogre::uint getIndex() const
01276     {
01277      return mIndex;
01278     }
01279     
01280     /*! function. _getSolidUV
01281         desc.
01282             Helper function to get a white pixel in the TextureAtlas.
01283     */
01284     inline Ogre::Vector2      _getSolidUV() const
01285     {
01286      return mParent->getAtlas()->getWhitePixel();
01287     }
01288     
01289     /*! function. _getSprite
01290         desc.
01291             Helper function to get a Sprite from the assigned texture atlas.
01292     */
01293     inline Sprite*            _getSprite(const Ogre::String& sprite_name) const
01294     {
01295      return mParent->getAtlas()->getSprite(sprite_name);
01296     }
01297     
01298     /*! function. _getGlyph
01299         desc.
01300             Helper function to get a Glyph from the assigned texture atlas.
01301     */
01302     inline GlyphData*         _getGlyphData(Ogre::uint id) const
01303     {
01304      return mParent->getAtlas()->getGlyphData(id);
01305     }
01306     
01307     /*! function. _getGlyph
01308         desc.
01309             Helper function to get the used texture size.
01310     */
01311     inline Ogre::Vector2      _getTextureSize() const
01312     {
01313      return mParent->getAtlas()->getTextureSize();
01314     }
01315     
01316     /*! function. _getAtlas
01317         desc.
01318             Helper function to get the used TextureAtlas.
01319     */
01320     inline TextureAtlas*      _getAtlas() const
01321     {
01322      return mParent->getAtlas();
01323     }
01324     
01325     /*! function. _getTexelX
01326         desc.
01327             Helper function to get the offset X texel coordinate.
01328     */
01329     inline Ogre::Real         _getTexelX() const
01330     {
01331      return mParent->getTexelOffsetX();
01332     }
01333     
01334     /*! function. _getTexelX
01335         desc.
01336             Helper function to get the offset Y texel coordinate.
01337     */
01338     inline Ogre::Real         _getTexelY() const
01339     {
01340      return mParent->getTexelOffsetY();
01341     }
01342     
01343     /*! function. _getMarkupColour
01344         desc.
01345             Helper function to get the markup colourvalue.
01346     */
01347     inline Ogre::ColourValue  _getMarkupColour(Ogre::uint index) const
01348     {
01349      return mParent->getAtlas()->getMarkupColour(index);
01350     }
01351     
01352     /*! function. _markDirty
01353         desc.
01354             Make this layer redraw itself on the next time that
01355             Gorilla updates to the screen.
01356         note.
01357             This shouldn't be needed to be called by the user.
01358     */
01359     void _markDirty();
01360     
01361    protected:
01362     
01363     void _render(buffer<Vertex>&, bool force = false);
01364 
01365     Layer(Ogre::uint index, LayerContainer*);
01366     
01367    ~Layer();
01368     
01369     Ogre::uint               mIndex;
01370     Rectangles               mRectangles;
01371     Polygons                 mPolygons;
01372     LineLists                mLineLists;
01373     QuadLists                mQuadLists;
01374     Captions                 mCaptions;
01375     MarkupTexts              mMarkupTexts;
01376     LayerContainer*          mParent;
01377     bool                     mVisible;
01378     Ogre::Real               mAlphaModifier;
01379     
01380   };
01381   
01382   /*! class. Rectangle
01383       desc.
01384           Single rectangle with an optional border.
01385   */
01386   class Rectangle : public Ogre::GeneralAllocatedObject
01387   {
01388    
01389    friend class Layer;
01390    
01391    public:
01392     
01393     /*! function. intersects
01394         desc.
01395             Does a set of coordinates lie within this rectangle?
01396     */
01397     inline bool intersects(const Ogre::Vector2& coordinates) const
01398     {
01399      return ((coordinates.x >= mLeft && coordinates.x <= mRight) && (coordinates.y >= mTop && coordinates.y <= mBottom));
01400     }
01401     
01402     /*! function. position
01403         desc.
01404             Get the position
01405     */
01406     inline Ogre::Vector2 position() const
01407     {
01408      return Ogre::Vector2(mLeft, mTop);
01409     }
01410     
01411     /*! function. position
01412         desc.
01413             Set the position
01414     */
01415     inline void position(const Ogre::Real& l, const Ogre::Real& t)
01416     {
01417      left(l);
01418      top(t);
01419     }
01420     /*! function. position
01421         desc.
01422             Set the position
01423     */
01424     inline void position(const Ogre::Vector2& position)
01425     {
01426      left(position.x);
01427      top(position.y);
01428     }
01429     
01430     /*! function. left 
01431         desc.
01432             Get left position
01433     */
01434     inline Ogre::Real  left() const
01435     {
01436      return mLeft;
01437     }
01438 
01439     /*! function. left 
01440         desc.
01441             Set left position
01442     */
01443     inline void  left(const Ogre::Real& left)
01444     {
01445      Ogre::Real w = width();
01446      mLeft = left;
01447      mRight = left + w;
01448      mDirty = true;
01449      mLayer->_markDirty();
01450     }
01451 
01452     /*! function. top 
01453         desc.
01454             Get top position
01455     */
01456     inline Ogre::Real  top() const
01457     {
01458      return mTop;
01459     }
01460 
01461     /*! function. top 
01462         desc.
01463             Set top position
01464     */
01465     inline void  top(const Ogre::Real& top)
01466     {
01467      Ogre::Real h = height();
01468      mTop = top;
01469      mBottom = top + h;
01470      mDirty = true;
01471      mLayer->_markDirty();
01472     }
01473 
01474     /*! function. width 
01475         desc.
01476             Get the width
01477     */
01478     inline Ogre::Real  width() const
01479     {
01480      return mRight - mLeft;
01481     }
01482 
01483     /*! function. width 
01484         desc.
01485             Set the width
01486     */
01487     inline void  width(const Ogre::Real& width)
01488     {
01489      mRight = mLeft + width;
01490      mDirty = true;
01491      mLayer->_markDirty();
01492     }
01493 
01494     /*! function. height 
01495         desc.
01496             Get the height
01497     */
01498     Ogre::Real  height() const
01499     {
01500      return mBottom - mTop;
01501     }
01502 
01503     /*! function. height 
01504         desc.
01505             Set the height
01506     */
01507     inline void  height(const Ogre::Real& height)
01508     {
01509      mBottom = mTop + height;
01510      mDirty = true;
01511      mLayer->_markDirty();
01512     }
01513     
01514     /*! function. no_background 
01515         desc.
01516             Don't draw the background.
01517         note.
01518             This just sets the background colour alpha to zero. Which on the next
01519             draw tells Rectangle to skip over drawing the background.
01520     */
01521     void  no_background()
01522     {
01523      mBackgroundColour[0].a = 0;
01524      mDirty = true;
01525      mLayer->_markDirty();
01526     }
01527 
01528     /*! function. no_border 
01529         desc.
01530             Don't draw the border.
01531         note.
01532             This just sets the border to zero. Which on the next
01533             draw tells Rectangle to skip over drawing the border.
01534     */
01535     void  no_border()
01536     {
01537      mBorderWidth = 0;
01538      mDirty = true;
01539      mLayer->_markDirty();
01540     }
01541     
01542     /*! function. background_colour
01543         desc.
01544             Get a background colour of a specific corner.
01545     */
01546     Ogre::ColourValue  background_colour(QuadCorner index) const
01547     {
01548      return mBackgroundColour[index];
01549     }
01550 
01551     /*! function. background_colour
01552         desc.
01553             Set a background colour to all corners.
01554     */
01555     void  background_colour(const Ogre::ColourValue& colour)
01556     {
01557      mBackgroundColour[0] = colour;
01558      mBackgroundColour[1] = colour;
01559      mBackgroundColour[2] = colour;
01560      mBackgroundColour[3] = colour;
01561      mDirty = true;
01562      mLayer->_markDirty();
01563     }
01564 
01565     /*! function. background_colour
01566         desc.
01567             Set a background colour to all corners.
01568     */
01569     void  background_colour(Gorilla::Colours::Colour colour)
01570     {
01571      mBackgroundColour[0] = webcolour(colour);
01572      mBackgroundColour[1] = mBackgroundColour[0];
01573      mBackgroundColour[2] = mBackgroundColour[0];
01574      mBackgroundColour[3] = mBackgroundColour[0];
01575      mDirty = true;
01576      mLayer->_markDirty();
01577     }
01578     
01579     /*! function. background_colour
01580         desc.
01581             Set a background colour to a specific corner.
01582     */
01583     void  background_colour(QuadCorner index, const Ogre::ColourValue& colour)
01584     {
01585      mBorderColour[index] = colour;
01586      mDirty = true;
01587      mLayer->_markDirty();
01588     }
01589     
01590     /*! function. background_gradient
01591         desc.
01592             Set the background to a gradient.
01593     */
01594     void  background_gradient(Gradient gradient, const Ogre::ColourValue& colourA, const Ogre::ColourValue& colourB)
01595     {
01596      if (gradient == Gradient_NorthSouth)
01597      {
01598       mBackgroundColour[0] = mBackgroundColour[1] = colourA;
01599       mBackgroundColour[2] = mBackgroundColour[3] = colourB;
01600      }
01601      else if (gradient == Gradient_WestEast)
01602      {
01603       mBackgroundColour[0] = mBackgroundColour[3] = colourA;
01604       mBackgroundColour[1] = mBackgroundColour[2] = colourB;
01605      }
01606      else if (gradient == Gradient_Diagonal)
01607      {
01608       Ogre::ColourValue avg;
01609       avg.r = (colourA.r + colourB.r) * 0.5f;
01610       avg.g = (colourA.g + colourB.g) * 0.5f;
01611       avg.b = (colourA.b + colourB.b) * 0.5f;
01612       avg.a = (colourA.a + colourB.a) * 0.5f;
01613       mBackgroundColour[0] = colourA;
01614       mBackgroundColour[1] = avg = mBackgroundColour[3] = avg;
01615       mBackgroundColour[2] = colourB;
01616      }
01617      mDirty = true;
01618      mLayer->_markDirty();
01619     }
01620     
01621     /*! function. background_image
01622         desc.
01623             Set the background to a sprite from the texture atlas.
01624         note.
01625             To remove the image pass on a null pointer.
01626     */
01627     void  background_image(Sprite* sprite)
01628     {
01629      if (sprite == 0)
01630      {
01631       mUV[0] = mUV[1] = mUV[2] = mUV[3] = mLayer->_getSolidUV();
01632      }
01633      else
01634      {
01635       if (sprite == 0)
01636       {
01637 #if GORILLA_USES_EXCEPTIONS == 1
01638        OGRE_EXCEPT( Ogre::Exception::ERR_ITEM_NOT_FOUND, "Sprite name not found", __FUNC__ );
01639 #else
01640        return;
01641 #endif
01642       }
01643       Ogre::Real texelOffsetX = mLayer->_getTexelX(), texelOffsetY = mLayer->_getTexelY();
01644       texelOffsetX /= mLayer->_getTextureSize().x;
01645       texelOffsetY /= mLayer->_getTextureSize().y;
01646       mUV[0].x = mUV[3].x = sprite->uvLeft - texelOffsetX;
01647       mUV[0].y = mUV[1].y = sprite->uvTop - texelOffsetY;
01648       mUV[1].x = mUV[2].x = sprite->uvRight + texelOffsetX;
01649       mUV[2].y = mUV[3].y = sprite->uvBottom + texelOffsetX;
01650      }
01651      mDirty = true;
01652      mLayer->_markDirty();
01653     }
01654     
01655     /*! function. background_image
01656         desc.
01657             Set the background to a sprite from the texture atlas, with clipping.
01658             Clipping is used for example with RPM meters on HUDs, where a portion
01659             of the sprite needs to be shown to indicate the RPM on the car.
01660             
01661             widthClip  is a decimal percentage of the width of the sprite (0.0 none, 1.0 full)
01662             heightClip is a decimal percentage of the height of the sprite (0.0 none, 1.0 full)
01663             
01664             You should use this with the width() and height() functions for a full effect.
01665         note.
01666             To remove the image pass on a null pointer.
01667     */
01668     void  background_image(Sprite* sprite, Ogre::Real widthClip, Ogre::Real heightClip)
01669     {
01670      if (sprite == 0)
01671      {
01672       mUV[0] = mUV[1] = mUV[2] = mUV[3] = mLayer->_getSolidUV();
01673      }
01674      else
01675      {
01676       if (sprite == 0)
01677       {
01678 #if GORILLA_USES_EXCEPTIONS == 1
01679        OGRE_EXCEPT( Ogre::Exception::ERR_ITEM_NOT_FOUND, "Sprite name not found", __FUNC__ );
01680 #else
01681        return;
01682 #endif
01683       }
01684       Ogre::Real texelOffsetX = mLayer->_getTexelX(), texelOffsetY = mLayer->_getTexelY();
01685       texelOffsetX /= mLayer->_getTextureSize().x;
01686       texelOffsetY /= mLayer->_getTextureSize().y;
01687       mUV[0].x = mUV[3].x = sprite->uvLeft - texelOffsetX;
01688       mUV[0].y = mUV[1].y = sprite->uvTop - texelOffsetY;
01689       mUV[1].x = mUV[2].x = sprite->uvLeft + ( (sprite->uvRight - sprite->uvLeft) * widthClip ) + texelOffsetX;
01690       mUV[2].y = mUV[3].y = sprite->uvTop + ( (sprite->uvBottom - sprite->uvTop) * heightClip ) + texelOffsetY;
01691      }
01692      mDirty = true;
01693      mLayer->_markDirty();
01694     }
01695     
01696     /*! function. background_image
01697         desc.
01698             Set the background to a sprite from the texture atlas, with clipping.
01699             Clipping is used for example with RPM meters on HUDs, where a portion
01700             of the sprite needs to be shown to indicate the RPM on the car.
01701             
01702             widthClip  is a decimal percentage of the width of the sprite (0.0 none, 1.0 full)
01703             heightClip is a decimal percentage of the height of the sprite (0.0 none, 1.0 full)
01704             
01705             You should use this with the width() and height() functions for a full effect.
01706         note.
01707             To remove the image pass on a null pointer.
01708     */
01709     void  background_image(const Ogre::String& sprite_name_or_none, Ogre::Real widthClip, Ogre::Real heightClip)
01710     {
01711      if (sprite_name_or_none.length() == 0 || sprite_name_or_none == "none")
01712      {
01713       mUV[0] = mUV[1] = mUV[2] = mUV[3] = mLayer->_getSolidUV();
01714      }
01715      else
01716      {
01717       Sprite* sprite = mLayer->_getSprite(sprite_name_or_none);
01718       if (sprite == 0)
01719       {
01720 #if GORILLA_USES_EXCEPTIONS == 1
01721        OGRE_EXCEPT( Ogre::Exception::ERR_ITEM_NOT_FOUND, "Sprite name not found", __FUNC__ );
01722 #else
01723        return;
01724 #endif
01725       }
01726       Ogre::Real texelOffsetX = mLayer->_getTexelX(), texelOffsetY = mLayer->_getTexelY();
01727       texelOffsetX /= mLayer->_getTextureSize().x;
01728       texelOffsetY /= mLayer->_getTextureSize().y;
01729       mUV[0].x = mUV[3].x = sprite->uvLeft - texelOffsetX;
01730       mUV[0].y = mUV[1].y = sprite->uvTop - texelOffsetY;
01731       mUV[1].x = mUV[2].x = sprite->uvLeft + ( (sprite->uvRight - sprite->uvLeft) * widthClip ) + texelOffsetX;
01732       mUV[2].y = mUV[3].y = sprite->uvTop + ( (sprite->uvBottom - sprite->uvTop) * heightClip ) + texelOffsetY;
01733      }
01734      mDirty = true;
01735      mLayer->_markDirty();
01736     }
01737 
01738     /*! function. background_image
01739         desc.
01740             Set the background to a sprite from the texture atlas.
01741         note.
01742             To remove the image pass on "none" or a empty string
01743     */
01744     void  background_image(const Ogre::String& sprite_name_or_none)
01745     {
01746      if (sprite_name_or_none.length() == 0 || sprite_name_or_none == "none")
01747      {
01748       mUV[0] = mUV[1] = mUV[2] = mUV[3] = mLayer->_getSolidUV();
01749      }
01750      else
01751      {
01752       Sprite* sprite = mLayer->_getSprite(sprite_name_or_none);
01753       if (sprite == 0)
01754       {
01755 #if GORILLA_USES_EXCEPTIONS == 1
01756        OGRE_EXCEPT( Ogre::Exception::ERR_ITEM_NOT_FOUND, "Sprite name not found", __FUNC__ );
01757 #else
01758        return;
01759 #endif
01760       }
01761       
01762       Ogre::Real texelOffsetX = mLayer->_getTexelX(), texelOffsetY = mLayer->_getTexelY();
01763       texelOffsetX /= mLayer->_getTextureSize().x;
01764       texelOffsetY /= mLayer->_getTextureSize().y;
01765       mUV[0].x = mUV[3].x = sprite->uvLeft - texelOffsetX;
01766       mUV[0].y = mUV[1].y = sprite->uvTop - texelOffsetY;
01767       mUV[1].x = mUV[2].x = sprite->uvRight + texelOffsetX;
01768       mUV[2].y = mUV[3].y = sprite->uvBottom + texelOffsetY;
01769      }
01770      mDirty = true;
01771      mLayer->_markDirty();
01772     }
01773     
01774     /*! function. border_colour
01775         desc.
01776             Get the border colour.
01777     */
01778     Ogre::ColourValue  border_colour(Border index) const
01779     {
01780      return mBorderColour[index];
01781     }
01782 
01783     /*! function. border_colour
01784         desc.
01785             Set all of border to one colour 
01786     */
01787     void  border_colour(const Ogre::ColourValue& bordercolour)
01788     {
01789      mBorderColour[0] = bordercolour;
01790      mBorderColour[1] = bordercolour;
01791      mBorderColour[2] = bordercolour;
01792      mBorderColour[3] = bordercolour;
01793      mDirty = true;
01794      mLayer->_markDirty();
01795     }
01796 
01797     /*! function. border_colour
01798         desc.
01799             Set a border part to one colour. 
01800     */
01801     void  border_colour(Border index, const Ogre::ColourValue& bordercolour)
01802     {
01803      mBorderColour[index] = bordercolour;
01804      mDirty = true;
01805      mLayer->_markDirty();
01806     }
01807     
01808     /*! function. border_colour
01809         desc.
01810             Set all of border to one colour 
01811     */
01812     void  border_colour(Gorilla::Colours::Colour bordercolour)
01813     {
01814      mBorderColour[0] = webcolour(bordercolour);
01815      mBorderColour[1] = mBorderColour[0];
01816      mBorderColour[2] = mBorderColour[0];
01817      mBorderColour[3] = mBorderColour[0];
01818      mDirty = true;
01819      mLayer->_markDirty();
01820     }
01821 
01822     /*! function. border_colour
01823         desc.
01824             Set a border part to one colour. 
01825     */
01826     void  border_colour(Border index, Gorilla::Colours::Colour bordercolour)
01827     {
01828      mBorderColour[index] = webcolour(bordercolour);
01829      mDirty = true;
01830      mLayer->_markDirty();
01831     }
01832     
01833     /*! function. border_width
01834         desc.
01835             Get the border width
01836     */
01837     Ogre::Real  border_width() const
01838     {
01839      return mBorderWidth;
01840     }
01841 
01842     /*! function. border_width
01843         desc.
01844             Set the border width
01845     */
01846     void  border_width(Ogre::Real width)
01847     {
01848      mBorderWidth = width;
01849      mDirty = true;
01850      mLayer->_markDirty();
01851     }
01852     
01853     /*! function. border
01854         desc.
01855             Set the border width and colour.
01856     */
01857     void  border(Ogre::Real width, const Ogre::ColourValue& colour)
01858     {
01859      mBorderColour[0] = colour;
01860      mBorderColour[1] = mBorderColour[0];
01861      mBorderColour[2] = mBorderColour[0];
01862      mBorderColour[3] = mBorderColour[0];
01863      mBorderWidth = width;
01864      mDirty = true;
01865      mLayer->_markDirty();
01866     }
01867     
01868     /*! function. border
01869         desc.
01870             Set the border width and specific colours for each part.
01871     */
01872     void  border(Ogre::Real width, const Ogre::ColourValue& north, const Ogre::ColourValue& east, const Ogre::ColourValue& south, const Ogre::ColourValue& west)
01873     {
01874      mBorderColour[Border_North] = north;
01875      mBorderColour[Border_South] = south;
01876      mBorderColour[Border_East] = east;
01877      mBorderColour[Border_West] = west;
01878      mBorderWidth = width;
01879      mDirty = true;
01880      mLayer->_markDirty();
01881     }
01882     
01883     /*! function. border
01884         desc.
01885             Set the border width and colour.
01886     */
01887     void  border(Ogre::Real width, Gorilla::Colours::Colour colour)
01888     {
01889      mBorderColour[0] = webcolour(colour);
01890      mBorderColour[1] = mBorderColour[0];
01891      mBorderColour[2] = mBorderColour[0];
01892      mBorderColour[3] = mBorderColour[0];
01893      mBorderWidth = width;
01894      mDirty = true;
01895      mLayer->_markDirty();
01896     }
01897     
01898     /*! function. border
01899         desc.
01900             Set the border width and specific colours for each part.
01901     */
01902     void  border(Ogre::Real width, Gorilla::Colours::Colour north, Gorilla::Colours::Colour east, Gorilla::Colours::Colour south, Gorilla::Colours::Colour west)
01903     {
01904      mBorderColour[Border_North] = webcolour(north);
01905      mBorderColour[Border_South] = webcolour(south);
01906      mBorderColour[Border_East] = webcolour(east);
01907      mBorderColour[Border_West] = webcolour(west);
01908      mBorderWidth = width;
01909      mDirty = true;
01910      mLayer->_markDirty();
01911     }
01912 
01913     /*! function. _redraw
01914         desc.
01915             Redraw the rectangle
01916         note.
01917             This should not be needed to be called by the user.
01918     */
01919     void _redraw();
01920     
01921    protected:
01922     
01923     Rectangle(Ogre::Real left, Ogre::Real top, Ogre::Real width, Ogre::Real height, Layer* parent);
01924     
01925    ~Rectangle() {}
01926     
01927    protected:
01928     
01929     Layer*             mLayer;
01930     Ogre::Real         mLeft, mTop, mRight, mBottom, mBorderWidth;
01931     Ogre::ColourValue  mBackgroundColour[4];
01932     Ogre::ColourValue  mBorderColour[4];
01933     Ogre::Vector2      mUV[4];
01934     bool               mDirty;
01935     buffer<Vertex>     mVertices;
01936   };
01937   
01938   /*! class. Polygon
01939       desc.
01940           A regular n-sided polygon.
01941   */
01942   class Polygon : public Ogre::GeneralAllocatedObject
01943   {
01944    
01945    friend class Layer;
01946    
01947    public:
01948    
01949     /*! function. left 
01950         desc.
01951             Get left position
01952     */
01953     Ogre::Real  left() const
01954     {
01955      return mLeft;
01956     }
01957 
01958     /*! function. left 
01959         desc.
01960             Set left position
01961     */
01962     void  left(const Ogre::Real& left)
01963     {
01964      mLeft = left;
01965      mDirty = true;
01966      mLayer->_markDirty();
01967     }
01968 
01969     /*! function. left 
01970         desc.
01971             Get left position
01972     */
01973     Ogre::Real  top() const
01974     {
01975      return mTop;
01976     }
01977 
01978     /*! function. left 
01979         desc.
01980             Set left position
01981     */
01982     void  top(const Ogre::Real& top)
01983     {
01984      mTop = top;
01985      mDirty = true;
01986      mLayer->_markDirty();
01987     }
01988     
01989     /*! function. radius 
01990         desc.
01991             Get the radius of the polygon
01992     */
01993     Ogre::Real  radius() const
01994     {
01995      return mRadius;
01996     }
01997     
01998     /*! function. radius 
01999         desc.
02000             Set the radius of the polygon
02001     */
02002     void  radius(const Ogre::Real& radius)
02003     {
02004      mRadius = radius;
02005      mDirty = true;
02006      mLayer->_markDirty();
02007     }
02008     
02009     /*! function. sides 
02010         desc.
02011             Get the number of sides the polygon has.
02012     */
02013     size_t  sides() const
02014     {
02015      return mSides;
02016     }
02017     
02018     /*! function. sides 
02019         desc.
02020             Set the number of sides the polygon has.
02021         note.
02022             Number of sides must be at least 2.
02023     */
02024     void  sides(size_t sides)
02025     {
02026      if (sides < 3)
02027       sides = 3;
02028      mSides = sides;
02029      mDirty = true;
02030      mLayer->_markDirty();
02031     }
02032     
02033     /*! function. angle 
02034         desc.
02035             Get the angle of the polygon
02036     */
02037     Ogre::Radian  angle() const
02038     {
02039      return mAngle;
02040     }
02041     
02042     /*! function. angle 
02043         desc.
02044             Set the angle of the polygon.
02045     */
02046     void  angle(const Ogre::Radian& angle)
02047     {
02048      mAngle = angle;
02049      mDirty = true;
02050      mLayer->_markDirty();
02051     }
02052     
02053     /*! function. background_image 
02054         desc.
02055             Get the sprite used as a background image or null pointer
02056     */
02057     Sprite*  background_image() const
02058     {
02059      return mSprite;
02060     }
02061     
02062     /*! function. background_image 
02063         desc.
02064             Set the sprite used as a background image or null pointer to clear.
02065     */
02066     void  background_image(Sprite* sprite)
02067     {
02068      mSprite = sprite;
02069      mDirty = true;
02070      mLayer->_markDirty();
02071     }
02072     
02073     /*! function. background_image 
02074         desc.
02075             Set the sprite used as a background image from a string.
02076         note.
02077             Use a empty string or "none" to clear.
02078     */
02079     void  background_image(const Ogre::String& name_or_none)
02080     {
02081      if (name_or_none.size() == 0 || name_or_none == "none")
02082       mSprite = 0;
02083      else
02084       mSprite = mLayer->_getSprite(name_or_none);
02085      
02086      mDirty = true;
02087      mLayer->_markDirty();
02088     }
02089     
02090     /*! function. background_colour 
02091         desc.
02092             Get the background colour.
02093     */
02094     Ogre::ColourValue  background_colour() const
02095     {
02096      return mBackgroundColour;
02097     }
02098     
02099     /*! function. background_colour 
02100         desc.
02101             Set the background colour.
02102         note.
02103             If there is a background sprite then it will be tinted by this colour.
02104     */
02105     void  background_colour(const Ogre::ColourValue& colour)
02106     {
02107      mBackgroundColour = colour;
02108      mDirty = true;
02109      mLayer->_markDirty();
02110     }
02111     
02112     /*! function. border 
02113         desc.
02114             Set the border width and colour
02115     */
02116     void border(Ogre::Real width, const Ogre::ColourValue& colour)
02117     {
02118      mBorderColour = colour;
02119      mBorderWidth = width;
02120      mDirty = true;
02121      mLayer->_markDirty();
02122     }
02123     
02124     /*! function. border 
02125         desc.
02126             Set the border width and colour
02127     */
02128     void border(Ogre::Real width, Gorilla::Colours::Colour colour)
02129     {
02130      if (colour == Gorilla::Colours::None)
02131      {
02132       mBorderColour.a = 0;
02133       mBorderWidth = 0;
02134      }
02135      else
02136      {
02137       mBorderColour = webcolour(colour);
02138       mBorderWidth = width;
02139      }
02140      mDirty = true;
02141      mLayer->_markDirty();
02142     }
02143 
02144     /*! function. border_colour 
02145         desc.
02146             Get the border colour
02147     */
02148     Ogre::ColourValue  border_colour() const
02149     {
02150      return mBorderColour;
02151     }
02152     
02153     /*! function. border_colour 
02154         desc.
02155             Set the border colour
02156     */
02157     void  border_colour(const Ogre::ColourValue& bordercolour)
02158     {
02159      mBorderColour = bordercolour;
02160      mDirty = true;
02161      mLayer->_markDirty();
02162     }
02163     
02164     /*! function. border_colour 
02165         desc.
02166             Set the border colour
02167     */
02168     void  border_colour(Gorilla::Colours::Colour colour)
02169     {
02170      if (colour == Gorilla::Colours::None)
02171      {
02172       mBorderColour.a = 0;
02173      }
02174      else
02175      {
02176       mBorderColour = webcolour(colour);
02177      }
02178      mDirty = true;
02179      mLayer->_markDirty();
02180     }
02181     
02182     /*! function. border_width 
02183         desc.
02184             Get the border width
02185     */
02186     Ogre::Real  border_width() const
02187     {
02188      return mBorderWidth;
02189     }
02190     
02191     /*! function. border_width 
02192         desc.
02193             Set the border width
02194     */
02195     void  border_width(Ogre::Real width)
02196     {
02197      mBorderWidth = width;
02198      mDirty = true;
02199      mLayer->_markDirty();
02200     }
02201     
02202 
02203     /*! function. no_background 
02204         desc.
02205             Don't draw the background.
02206         note.
02207             This just sets the background colour alpha to zero. Which on the next
02208             draw tells Rectangle to skip over drawing the background.
02209     */
02210     void  no_background()
02211     {
02212      mBackgroundColour.a = 0;
02213      mDirty = true;
02214      mLayer->_markDirty();
02215     }
02216 
02217     /*! function. no_border 
02218         desc.
02219             Don't draw the border.
02220         note.
02221             This just sets the border to zero. Which on the next
02222             draw tells Rectangle to skip over drawing the border.
02223     */
02224     void  no_border()
02225     {
02226      mBorderWidth = 0;
02227      mDirty = true;
02228      mLayer->_markDirty();
02229     }
02230 
02231     /*! function. _redraw
02232         desc.
02233             Redraw the polygon
02234         note.
02235             This should not be needed to be called by the user.
02236     */
02237     void  _redraw();
02238     
02239     protected:
02240     
02241      
02242     Polygon(Ogre::Real left, Ogre::Real top, Ogre::Real radius, size_t sides, Layer* parent);
02243     
02244    ~Polygon() {}
02245     
02246     Layer*             mLayer;
02247     Ogre::Real         mLeft, mTop, mRadius, mBorderWidth;
02248     Ogre::Radian       mAngle;
02249     size_t             mSides;
02250     Ogre::ColourValue  mBackgroundColour, mBorderColour;
02251     Sprite*            mSprite;
02252     bool               mDirty;
02253     buffer<Vertex>     mVertices;
02254     
02255   };
02256   
02257   class LineList : public Ogre::GeneralAllocatedObject
02258   {
02259    
02260    friend class Layer;
02261    
02262    public:
02263     
02264     /*! function. begin
02265         desc.
02266             Clear lines and start again
02267     */
02268     void  begin(Ogre::Real lineThickness = 1.0f, const Ogre::ColourValue& colour = Ogre::ColourValue::White);
02269     
02270     /*! function. begin
02271         desc.
02272             Clear lines and start again
02273     */
02274     void  begin(Ogre::Real lineThickness, Gorilla::Colours::Colour colour)
02275     {
02276      begin(lineThickness, webcolour(colour));
02277     }
02278     
02279     /*! function. position
02280         desc.
02281             Extent the list to x and y.
02282     */
02283     void  position(Ogre::Real x, Ogre::Real y);
02284     
02285     /*! function. position
02286         desc.
02287             Extent the list to given coordinates.
02288     */
02289     void  position(const Ogre::Vector2&);
02290     
02291     /*! function. end
02292         desc.
02293             Stop line drawing and calculate vertices.
02294         note.
02295             If "isClosed" is set to true, then the line list joins back to the first position.
02296     */
02297     void  end(bool isClosed = false);
02298     
02299     /*! function. _redraw
02300         desc.
02301             Redraw the line list
02302         note.
02303             This should not be needed to be called by the user.
02304     */
02305     void  _redraw();
02306     
02307    protected:
02308     
02309     LineList(Layer* parent);
02310     
02311    ~LineList() {}
02312     
02313    protected:
02314     
02315     Layer*                mLayer;
02316     Ogre::Real            mThickness;
02317     Ogre::ColourValue     mColour;
02318     bool                  mIsClosed;
02319     buffer<Ogre::Vector2> mPositions;
02320     bool                  mDirty;
02321     buffer<Vertex>        mVertices;
02322   };

02324   /*! class. QuadList
02325       desc.
02326           "ManualObject" like class to quickly draw rectangles, gradients, sprites and borders.
02327   */
02328   class QuadList : public Ogre::GeneralAllocatedObject
02329   {
02330    
02331    friend class Layer;
02332    
02333    public:
02334     
02335     /*! function. begin
02336         desc.
02337             Clear everything and start again
02338     */
02339     void  begin();
02340     
02341     /*! function. rectangle
02342         desc.
02343             Draw a rectangle sized w,h at x,y
02344     */
02345     void  rectangle(Ogre::Real x, Ogre::Real y, Ogre::Real w, Ogre::Real h, const Ogre::ColourValue = Ogre::ColourValue::White);
02346     
02347     /*! function. gradient
02348         desc.
02349             Draw a gradient rectangle sized w,h at x,y
02350     */
02351     void  gradient(Ogre::Real x, Ogre::Real y, Ogre::Real w, Ogre::Real h, Gradient gradient, const Ogre::ColourValue& colourA = Ogre::ColourValue::White, const Ogre::ColourValue& colourB = Ogre::ColourValue::White);
02352     
02353     /*! function. gradient
02354         desc.
02355             Draw a gradient rectangle sized w,h at x,y
02356     */
02357     void  gradient(Ogre::Real x, Ogre::Real y, Ogre::Real w, Ogre::Real h, Gradient gradient, const Gorilla::Colours::Colour& colourA, const Gorilla::Colours::Colour& colourB)
02358     {
02359      this->gradient(x,y,w,h,gradient, webcolour(colourA), webcolour(colourB));
02360     }
02361     
02362     /*! function. sprite
02363         desc.
02364             Draw a sprite sized w,h at x,y
02365     */
02366     void  sprite(Ogre::Real x, Ogre::Real y, Ogre::Real w, Ogre::Real h, Sprite*);
02367     
02368     /*! function. border
02369         desc.
02370             Draw a border sized w,h at x,y of a thickness
02371     */
02372     void  border(Ogre::Real x, Ogre::Real y, Ogre::Real w, Ogre::Real h, Ogre::Real thickness, const Ogre::ColourValue& = Ogre::ColourValue::White);
02373     
02374     /*! function. border
02375         desc.
02376             Draw a border sized w,h at x,y of a thickness
02377     */
02378     void  border(Ogre::Real x, Ogre::Real y, Ogre::Real w, Ogre::Real h, Ogre::Real thickness, const Gorilla::Colours::Colour& colour)
02379     {
02380      border(x,y,w,h,thickness, webcolour(colour));
02381     }
02382     
02383     /*! function. border
02384         desc.
02385             Draw a border sized w,h at x,y of a thickness
02386     */
02387     void  border(Ogre::Real x, Ogre::Real y, Ogre::Real w, Ogre::Real h, Ogre::Real thickness, const Ogre::ColourValue& northColour, const Ogre::ColourValue& eastColour, const Ogre::ColourValue& southColour, const Ogre::ColourValue& westColour);
02388     
02389     /*! function. border
02390         desc.
02391             Draw a border sized w,h at x,y of a thickness
02392     */
02393     void  border(Ogre::Real x, Ogre::Real y, Ogre::Real w, Ogre::Real h, Ogre::Real thickness, const Gorilla::Colours::Colour& northColour, const Gorilla::Colours::Colour& eastColour, const Gorilla::Colours::Colour& southColour, const Gorilla::Colours::Colour& westColour)
02394     {
02395      border(x,y,w,h,thickness, webcolour(northColour), webcolour(eastColour), webcolour(southColour), webcolour(westColour));
02396     }
02397     
02398     /*! function. glyph
02399         desc.
02400             Draw a glpyh
02401     */
02402     void  glyph(Ogre::uint glyphDataIndex, Ogre::Real x, Ogre::Real y, unsigned char character, const Ogre::ColourValue& colour);
02403     
02404     /*! function. glyph
02405         desc.
02406             Draw a glyph with a custom size.
02407     */
02408     void  glyph(Ogre::uint glyphDataIndex, Ogre::Real x, Ogre::Real y, Ogre::Real w, Ogre::Real h, unsigned char character, const Ogre::ColourValue& colour);
02409     
02410     /*! function. glyph
02411         desc.
02412             Draw a glpyh
02413     */
02414     void  glyph(Ogre::uint glyphDataIndex, Ogre::Real x, Ogre::Real y, unsigned char character, const Gorilla::Colours::Colour& colour)
02415     {
02416      glyph(glyphDataIndex,x,y,character, webcolour(colour));
02417     }
02418     
02419     /*! function. glyph
02420         desc.
02421             Draw a glyph with a custom size.
02422     */
02423     void  glyph(Ogre::uint glyphDataIndex, Ogre::Real x, Ogre::Real y, Ogre::Real w, Ogre::Real h, unsigned char character, const Gorilla::Colours::Colour& colour)
02424     {
02425      glyph(glyphDataIndex, x,y,w,h, character, webcolour(colour));
02426     }
02427     
02428     /*! function. end
02429         desc.
02430             Stop drawing and calculate vertices.
02431     */
02432     void  end();
02433     
02434     void  _redraw();
02435     
02436    protected:
02437     
02438     QuadList(Layer*);
02439     
02440     ~QuadList() {}
02441     
02442     struct Quad
02443     {
02444      Ogre::Vector2        mPosition[4];
02445      Ogre::Vector2        mUV[4];
02446      Ogre::ColourValue    mColour[4];
02447     };
02448     
02449     Ogre::Vector2         mWhiteUV;
02450     Layer*                mLayer;
02451     buffer<Quad>          mQuads;
02452     buffer<Vertex>        mVertices;
02453     bool                  mDirty;
02454     
02455   };
